attributes.action: Restructure the QLTS assessment to allow candidates pace themselves
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is not in tune with modern professional examinations where examinations are split by subjects and candidates have the option of taking any subject/combination of subjects at their desired pace (example ACCA).
The examining body, Kaplan states that the assessments examine Outcomes C, D and F of the SRA's Day One Outcomes. 
This is prejudicial because all Day One Solicitors in England and Wales have the option sit the exams at their preffered pace.
attributes.background:
The QLTS allows foreign lawyers to qualify in England and Wales without the need to complete the full SRA training requirements.
It comprises of a Multiple Choice Test and an Objective Structured Clinical Examination where candidates take 18 assessed exercises:6 per subject, ALL IN 1 SITTING

rejection.details: The QLTS assessment is overseen by the Solicitors Regulation Authority, which is independent of Government and Parliament.
